comments.commentBody:
Judging by the some of the comments, I can only conclude many of the commentators have not bothered to actually watch the video prior to forming their opinions.

If you actually watch the video, you will see the pepper spray was gratuitous. It had nothing to do with gaining compliance from the students. The students did not resist before or after being sprayed. The officers ended up picking them off the ground and arresting them. That could have been done with or without the pepper spray.

I would like some transparency about UC Police use of force policy. The casual manner in which the pepper spray was administered suggested Lt. Pike and other officers were just following policy. If so, the outrage is compounded by those truly responsible hiding behind scapegoats.

So the woman wear longhair and long dresses and the men wear suspenders and grow beards.  The ones that are around Michigan are a peaceful, law abiding group.  I do care that their education permits no one to go beyond 8th grade and they live their lives in deep ignorance.  Still they practice their religion and live in a kindly non confrontational manner. I must admit that their religious practices emulate Christ more than any so called main stream religions  of the dominant class.
You can't ridicule and claim to be tolerant. The hatred spewing forth in these comments is unbecoming of a dignified civilization.
I often wonder why atheists are so eager to snap at and insult anyone who does not believe in their religion.

This is the quintessence of stupidity. As Jonathan Edwards said, infinite upon infinite. At least Edwards was able to philosophize in sophisticated ways about the absurdity of his faith. At least I think he realized how stupid he seemed, bawling out loud and closeting himself whenever her heard a thunderstorm. Heaven is here and now. Let's make the best of it people.

The Church prayed for the conversion of Russia since I was a boy. The collapse of the Soviet Union was because the Blessed Virgin Mary, the Queeen of Heaven herself was who we all responded to by praying the Holy Rosary. Prayer unleashes the most powerful force in the universe, otherwise Russia would never have returned to Christ.

Now we must pray for the conversion of the poor blind and dumb who can't hear the word of God here in the United States. When you are cured of your lack of faith, and unbelief you will understand the loving heart of Mary the Virgin Mother of Mercy, and you too would do anything to show your devotion to her Immaculate Heart.

To we who have the great gift of Faith, and who fear God, no additional explanation is needed for we know the truth. To the poor blind unbeliever no human explanation would make any difference. God must first beckon you and grant you the grace to begin to change, you are so steeped in sin you poor sinner are as yet powerless to change. Jesus wants you whose souls are blackened with sin not to fear to approach His Divine Mercy. Christ The Redeemer has an unfathomable ocean of mercy to wash away the sins of the worst sinner, and He is eager to do so. Repent your sins, pray for His Divine Mercy, and He will bring you home. You are the lost sheep, and He is the Good Shepherd who protects and and seeks out His lost sheep. The fool for Christ has wisdom greater than any in this world, and the wisdom of this world is not as wise as the foolishness of God. Don't allow your arrogance to blind you to salvation.

Americans are abysmally ignorant of the horrors perpetrated against the Russian Orthodox Church and the Russian people by the atheistic Soviet state in the twentieth century.  It was the worst genocide in human history-- 20 million Russians murdered in the name of atheistic communist "progress."  That the mystical faith of the Eastern Church survived this atheistic persecution is greatest miracle of all.

Through the simultaneity of quantum entanglement, to touch the belt of Jesus' mother enables one to be that much more intimate with the Creator of the Universe. But faith, too, can do that, as we are all so connected, across all space, and across all time. It is an expression, a celebration, a declaration of that faith, that choice to acknowledge that we know we did not create ourselves, and thus declare our love and gratitude to the Being who chose to give us our own being.
I hope the relic comes to America!
What joy!
What joy!

Well, in fairness to Obama, protecting Americans from a terrorist attack is not the same as protecting their civil liberties.  Obama's job is to do both.  I believe we need to carefully and thoroughly distinguish these two cases because too many people are convinced the slope between them is slippery or non-existent.

I am not sure whether the above posters don't believe we are in a real war with a real enemy that really wants to kill us.

Look at any war we won (that leaves out Viet Nam) and you'll see the many bad things we did to defeat a worse evil.

The problem with this case is that you can't really prosecute an agent for another country. You can't call the Iranian Revolutionary Guards as witnesses, hostile or otherwise.

For an example of what a farce this type of case can turn into, check out the case of Rudolf Abel, supposedly a Soviet spy who was actually a British subject. The US courts went through the whole process with no idea who they were accusing or the context of his actions, sentenced him based on his false identity, and finally released him to be exchanged for a captured US pilot. We could have skipped the whole charade and held "Abel" until he could be exchanged.

If you don't think we are in a real war, how many American civilians must die to change your mind?

I applaud the efforts of these entrepreneurs to reach more people. Though, I mus say that watching WikiLeaks get shut down by the multinational payment processors sent a chill down my spine.

It seems to me that the world needs alternate ways of sending and receiving money and that alternate non-governmental currencies need to be developed. Perhaps m-via, wizzit and the other services could be a step towards a liberated money supply?

If a person in custody knowingly and voluntarily waives his right to counsel and agrees to make self-incriminating statements, no Constitutional rights have been violated. Unless and until one of these defendants stands up in court and testifies under oath that he was coerced, and until or unless the prosecution fails to convincingly refute that testimony, then I see no reason to lament the erosion of Consitiutional rights, much less condemn the president.

I'd be very surprised if these waivers wern't thoroughly documented.

I'm in the Medicare generation and remember all those shows. But I don't advise spending a lot of time with them if you can enjoy 2011 comedy:
Parks and Rec, Community, 30 Rock, Happy Endings, Cougar Town, Sunny in Philadelphia, Louie, Bored to Death, How I Met Your Mother, Middle, Modern Family, Psych, Childrens Hospital, Big Bang Theory. And that leaves out animated and some great throwback shows such as iCarly and Hot in Cleveland. Leave It to Beaver? Where was Ozzie and Harriet in your fond memories?

Really? I Love Lucy?

I saw the candy factory episode when it was new, and I was something like 8 years old, and even then I thought it was painfully stupid. And when I go back and watch, via Hulu, old TV comedies, they're almost unwatchable, they're so bad. One of the few exceptions is those Bewitched episodes with Paul Lynde and/or Agnes Moorehead.

Compare those shows with Modern Family, 30 Rock, The Office, Parks and Rec, or Outnumbered (BBC), and to me, at least, its Bambi meets Godzilla, with the newer shows in the Godzilla role.

There are excellent sitcoms on TV - the problem you should be addressing is, why is no one watching them?

As others mentioned, Community is an innovative and hilarious sitcom that is near-cancellation. Arrested Development was cancelled. Parks & Recreation still struggles for ratings. 30 Rock, critically acclaimed, has always been a straggler. These - and more - are all fantastic, creative new sitcoms that are nevertheless unpopular.

We have lots of channels today; far more variety than ever before. Maybe the problem is that people don't turn to their TVs for innovation and creative entertainment - they turn to it for oblivion. Maybe now that we have the choice between mindless drivel and clever TV, that preference becomes a lot clearer.

I hope not, though. Because if it's true, those of us who enjoy a little intelligence with our humor are sh*t out of luck.

comments.commentBody: Michelle Williams was not the right choice for this movie. She is a terrible actress and does not posses any amount of the beauty and glamour as Marilyn Monroe did.

comments.commentBody: Marilyn was unique; and capturing her overt and essential qualities might not be possible in jaded 2011, and certainly not by Michelle Williams--but she gives a good effort

What is it that makes people in authority so obviously hate anyone who questions that authority?  Civil disobedience is the very foundation of the republic.  The uniformed people who are so blithely pushing around peaceful protesters are so often in the group of American willing to lay down their lives for their country.  The media, the cops, as well as local and state governments, fell all over themselves to point out the rights of Tea Partiers to sling their racist and incoherent messages.  Try listening to the OWS protesters, they have a lot more to say that makes a lot more sense than anyone I've heard on the right.

This story is stunning.

FIVE (!) boys went missing/were murdered and nobody was even charged until 2011?? (And the only person ever charged was found not guilty.) Reminds me of the horrible murders of those three little boys 18 years ago whose murderer/s were never found, either (three young men were wrongly imprisoned and recently released).

Crimes against children -- of any colour -- seem to be the last to be solved. As a parent, these stories are heartbreaking.

If this all they really had, then how on earth was an indictment granted? And how on earth did the case not get tossed out before even starting the expensive trial by jury process?

Malfeasance all around. Taxpayer $ mean nothing to most government bureaucrats.

@ #&--no mention here of the race of the victims, so . .???

And @ #16--absolutely!! He could have put himself on the stand. Kids were killed, and justice has not been served. WHY would a prisoner make up a confession???? His cousin outed him, and the liberal jury bought it. The juror who opined that "a single eye witness" was not enough witnesses-----omg!!! How many eye witnesses do we usually have for murder? Jurors-your "peers." Chilling thought.

"Or Scandinavian options like Jonsson/Jonsdottir?"

I'll tell you what they do nowadays in Iceland if you're considered a "feminist"- they name the baby after both mother and father, i.e. Magnus Ingasson Jonsson, so basically replacing a middle name with another surname. Some of my relatives have done this and some of them think it's silly and a mouthful for the kids.

My mother didn't change her name to my father's last name until after I was born and they wouldn't give me to her in the hospital one time because we had different last names. That was 30 years ago and times have changed, I know, but I think there is something unifying about having the same last name as your family members and I wanted to share surnames with my kids and my husband, so we all have his last name and I use my maiden name as my middle, like my mother ended up doing. I don't feel like my husband "owns" me and the kids or something because we have his last name.

The real crime was committed back some thirty ears earlier when the police decided not to investigate this as a crime. If I were the relatives I would look to sue the police department for damages in a civil law suit. They should also sue Evans for damages. Anyone who thinks this guy proved his innocence is being ridiculous. Go read the details of who this "snitch" was along with his relationship to this defendant as well as the other details which fit with his story. The families suspected it was Evans and there should have been an investigation. Furthermore, his cousin was not gaining a lesser sentence by being a snitch. What he had gained over time was the ability to avoid the death penalty.

If only we were as keen on having real banking regulation and enforcing it as apparently we are on enforcing park curfews and no-camping rules.

But those who swindle billions don't get pepper-sprayed. They just get bailout money and winked at while they do it again. Neither party is stopping them, because both are in their pocket.

And yet, I still hear people ask "Why are those Occupy Wall Street people so angry? What are they angry about?"

This, folks, is it!

Well, next time some GOP Congress person fights against enforcement of regulations, and stronger regulations show them these affidavits and defense documents ... let's see them demand de-regulation when faced with bankers blaming lack of regulation enforcement for fiscal crisis!
